poem:
Title: Axe Falls Silent

In stern halls of judgement, Badinter stood,
Tenderness of truth in his heart's wood,
Opposing the oldest, cruelest good.
Life, he insisted, not to be unmade
By silken stroke of the guillotine's blade.
Now silenced, his noble part is played.
Yet lives he still in each pardon's shade,
In mercy's hymn, compassion unswayed.
